headline: JD Vance's hapless senate campaign destroyed after ‘electorally stupid’ Ukraine comment: conservative
author: Sarah K. Burris
sentences:
— Michael Brodkorb (@Michael Brodkorb) 1645750979
“Michael Brodkorb, former deputy chair of the Minnesota Republican Party, observed that ‘numerous Republican operatives’ were ‘fuming’ about the selection of Vance as the keynote speaker, highlighting Vance’s ill-informed and callous — not to mention electorally stupid — comments about Russia’s invasion of Ukraine as a primary reason for their ire.

pic.twitter.com/nBEqVJWFjD
— Brian McClung (@Brian McClung) 1646163936
As it turns out, McClung wasn't the only GOP operative to say they weren't interested in giving a donation of any kind to see Vance speak.
"Scheduled on April Fool’s Day with no apparent sense of irony, the invite went out in late February and almost immediately, Minnesota Republicans pushed back against Vance’s selection," wrote Swift.

Writing for the Bulwark, Jim Swift explained that the far-right candidate isn't doing well in his efforts to become the next famous Republican politician.
As it turns out, he's only polling in third place in the race and he's been nixed from speaking at the Minnesota GOP’s annual Lincoln-Reagan dinner.
After weeks of bombs falling on civilians all over social media and U.S. news, the support for those fighting Vladimir Putin is soaring.
It's clear he made a miscalculation about where the American people were on the issue, and more specifically, his own voters.
He was already controversial, but after his statements about the war, his political career appears to be collapsing.
Vance made it clear last month that he doesn't "really care" about the invasion thousands of miles away in Europe.
